messages.text: are you on the bus beth? the number 12? headed to school?
yes dad
first day of high school! exciting times! :-)
:( i’d rather be home in my room reading and drawing
u didn’t even walk me to the city bus stop :’(
i had to get to work. besides, you said it would embarrass you if
i’m all alone outside in the cold cruel world..
you were ‘all alone’ locked up in your room all summer long
it will do you good to get out into the real world and socialize
and stop over-dramatizing everything!
i’m sensitive! i’m sure i have some sort of social anxiety
stop it beth! we’ve been through all that
the doctor said you’re fine – just shy
now you have a chance to meet new teachers and make new friends at school! :-)
you can’t just live in your imagination all the
my imagination is such a nice warm safe place where i have total control over
dad
yes. what is it?
dad!
what is it beth?
DAD.. there’s something wrong with the bus driver
what do you mean?
we’re picking up speed
the bus driver’s not making any stops
we’re going way too fast dad!
beth are you making this up to
passengers are screaming!
DAD
beth.. ring the bell.. maybe
we just blew right through a red light!
the bus barely missed hitting a cement truck in the intersection – by inches!
maybe the driver.. has passed out or something.. someone needs to check on
we just blew through another red light dad!
the bus hit a car – sent it spinning!
DAD
HELP
stay calm beth! i’ve called the police!
they know about it.. already. they’re
a man’s banging on the protective plastic shield around the bus driver at the front! kicking at it! but he can’t
OMG
what beth!?
the driver slammed on the brakes.. then sped up again
the man went flying against the windshield! he’s down on the floor! not moving!
sit tight beth! hold on! the police
OMG
what!?
the woman next to me hit her forehead on the seat in front when the driver braked!
there’s blood pouring out of a cut! all over her face!
DAD WHAT SHOULD I
get your sweatshirt out of your backpack and press it against her wound! it’ll stop the bleeding!
beth!?
BETH
i did it dad! the bleeding’s not so bad now..
the woman – Marie – is pressing my sweatshirt against
there’re police cars behind us dad! chasing after us!
and more up ahead trying to clear the intersections!
we must be going 60 miles an hour! on rush hour streets!
people are crying and screaming dad!
the police will stop the bus beth!
HOW!?
they’ll pull the driver over.. put up a barricade.. shoot
we’ll all be killed if we crash!
Marie thinks that’s what the bus driver is counting on!
she says he must be on a suicide run or
OMG!!
what!?
OMG!!
BETH!?
a little boy.. a little baby boy.. just went out the window dad!!
his mother had fainted i guess and he climbed over her shoulder for the open window and the bus hit a pothole and the wind..
before anybody could stop him!!
DAD WHAT SHOULD I DO!!??
try to remain calm beth! the police will somehow
we ran over a spike strip!
but we’re not slowing down any!
the bus is rocking from side to side now! we’re all bouncing around!
hold on tight beth!
a man is signalling at me dad!
don’t do anything foolish!!
beth!?
BETH
WHAT’S HAPPENING BETH?
James – the man – is going to pound on the side of the plastic protective shield.. to distract the bus driver
and.. i’m going to climb up and squirm over the top of the partition from behind.. where the driver can’t see me
no beth!! that’s way too
i’m the only one small enough to squeeze through the gap between the partition and the roof of the bus..
i’ll drop down onto the driver and jump on the brake and pop open the door and let the police
NO BETH
that’s far too dangerous!! wait for
we’re weaving all over the road dad! at high speed!
we’re going to crash for sure!! James and i have to
beth!?
BETH
BETH
please..
be careful beth
dad?
YES?
WHAT HAPPENED?
it.. worked!! :)))
i’ve got a few bruises.. but i surprised the driver and jumped right into his lap and stomped on the brake..
LORD HAVE MERCY
and the police stormed inside and tasered the driver and ripped out the protective shield and
we’re stopped dad!! :))
thank god you’re ok beth!!
you’re a hero! a ‘real-life’ hero! ;-))
beth!?
i’m shaking so hard i can hardly type :O
and hugging James and Marie and all the other passengers :’)
i.. uh.. hope this doesn’t traumatize.. i mean, it’s not going to be like this every day
are u kidding dad!? i can’t wait to get to school now! :-P
who knew ‘real life’ could be so rewarding! ;)
and precious <3
